Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the lantibiotics family (Class I bacteriocin)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: There are extensive post-translational modifications: T1, T4 and T8 are dehydrated into Dhb. The N-terminal Dhb was unstable and further oxidized by deamination into 2-oxo butyrate. In addition, thioether or methylthioether bonds occur between the following residue pairs: S11-C15, T17-C21, T20-C23, S24-C28, and S27-C31.
Sequence Information.Comments: Therefore the most likely sequence for the lantibiotic is Dhb*-W-A-Dhb-I-G-K-Dhb-I-V-Q-Dha-V-K-K-C-R-Dhb-F-Dhb-C-G-C-Dha-L-G-Dha-C-Dha-N-C-N, where the underlined amino acids have been experimentally confirmed by mass spectrometric analysis and the subsequent sequence predicted from the genomic sequence of strain MMA7.

Literature.Title: Subtilomycin a new lantibiotic from Bacillus subtilis strain MMA7 isolated from the marine sponge Haliclona simulans.
Literature.Author: Phelan RW, Barret M, Cotter PD, O'Connor PM, Chen R, Morrissey JP, Dobson AD, O'Gara F, Barbosa TM.
